keyPolicies.policyDescription: Wants a referendum on Europe. Wants the UK to declare that our Supreme Court can overrule decisions of the European Court of Human Rights in Strasbourg.
Only UKIP will control immigration properly.
Believes in the need to re-open some of our coal pits, and Swadlincote is a good example.
Wants legislation to allow Pubs and Clubs to create separate smoking rooms/bars with separate entrances.
Wants the Hunting with Dogs Act repealed.

issues.brexitEurope: Wants a referendum on Europe and wants the UK's Supreme Court to have supremacy over the European Court of Human Rights.
issues.economy: Supports re-opening coal pits, with Swadlincote as an example.
issues.immigration: Promises that UKIP will control immigration properly.

leaflet.personalStatement: Charles Swabey joined the army at 18, served with an armoured Regiment, became a barrister, retired as a Lt Col, and now runs his own internet advertising business. He is married with 5 children and (so far) 5 grand-children, and lives near Ashbourne in Derbyshire.

contactInformation.address: Swabey, Lintwood Farmhouse, Osmaston, Ashbourne, Derbyshire, DE6 1LX

images.caption: Charles Swabey's campaign leaflet featuring his personal statement, key policies, and political stances.
